messages.title: If elected I will fight for:
messages.content:
1. A new NHS 'walk-in' centre east of the Itchen
2. A new Police Station east of the river and more police on the streets
3. A massive Council Home building programme for Southampton
4. Better public transport including extra bus routes for the east of the river
5. An end to rough sleeping in Southampton

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A new NHS 'walk-in' centre east of the Itchen and keeping the NHS in public ownership with more investment in doctors, nurses, therapists and other care workers.
A new Police Station east of the river and more police on the streets.
A massive Council Home building programme for Southampton.
Better public transport including extra bus routes for the east of the river.
An end to rough sleeping in Southampton.

- Keep the NHS in public ownership with more investment in doctors, nurses, therapists and other care workers.
- Real Living Wage of £10 an hour and no increase in Income Tax or National Insurance for 95% of people.
- A Green Industrial Revolution creating 400,000 jobs.
- Free school meals for all primary school children and reduced class sizes for 5, 6 & 7 year olds.
- Keep the Winter Fuel Allowance, free TV licences and bus passes for pensioners.

leaflet.personalStatement: Simon and his wife Carolyn brought their children up in our city. Science teacher Simon led our City Council and served as a Councillor in Bitterne.

politicalExperience.achievements: Simon recognised the climate emergency back in 2017, well ahead of other councils and will push for further government action on it. He brought to an end the 'bin men's' strike in 2012, orchestrated by Royston Smith, that left one million rotting bin bags on the streets of our city. He introduced the living wage for council employees. He led the City Deal that funded West Quay South where thousands of residents enjoy our unique city.
